alert.note: Alert for Sioux (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 6:28AM CDT until April 18 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Dakota...Iowa...Minnesota... Big Sioux River below Dell Rapids affecting Minnehaha County. Rock River at Rock Rapids affecting Lyon County. West Fork Des Moines River near Avoca affecting Cottonwood and Murray Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota...Iowa...Minnesota... James River at Huron affecting Beadle County. James River near Forestburg affecting Sanborn County. Big Sioux River near Egan affecting Moody County. Big Sioux River near Richland affecting Union and Plymouth Counties. Big Sioux River at Brandon affecting Lyon, Lincoln and Minnehaha Counties. Big Sioux River near Estelline affecting Hamlin and Brookings Counties. Big Sioux River at Sioux Falls I-90 affecting Minnehaha County. Big Sioux River near Bruce affecting Brookings County. Big Sioux River near Canton affecting Lyon, Lincoln and Sioux Counties. Big Sioux River at Akron affecting Union and Plymouth Counties. Big Sioux River near Brookings affecting Moody and Brookings Counties. Big Sioux River above Hawarden affecting Union, Lincoln and Sioux Counties. Rock River near Hardwick affecting Rock County. Redwood River at Russell affecting Lyon County. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Sioux River above Hawarden. * WHEN...Until Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, some farm houses on the South Dakota side of the river are isolated by high water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 22.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:30 AM CDT Thursday was 22.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to slowly fall into the weekend, falling below flood stage Monday. - Flood stage is 20.5 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Big Sioux River Hawarden 20.5 22.9 Thu 5 am 22.3 21.7 21.0 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Thursday afternoon.
